unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Type I error: Waiting Time
question_text: A valet company claims that a customer's  average wait time for their car is $8\text{ minutes}$ .   After waiting $20\text{ minutes}$ to get your car, Bobby believes the valet company's time to get a car is greater than $8\text{ minutes}$ . Which of the following describes a type I error in the context of this situation?

choices.text: Bobby concludes the average wait time it takes the valet company to get a car is 8 minutes 8 minutes , when it is actually greater than 8 minutes 8 minutes .
Bobby concludes the average wait time it takes the valet company to get a car is  greater than 8 minutes 8 minutes , when it is actually 8 minutes 8 minutes .
Bobby concludes the average wait time it takes the valet company to get a car is greater than 8 minutes 8 minutes , when it is actually is  greater than 8 minutes 8 minutes .
Bobby concludes the average wait time it takes the valet company to get a car is 8 minutes 8 minutes , when it is actually is 8 minutes 8 minutes .
A type I error cannot be committed in this situation
